info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 5 at 6:18PM MDT until July 5 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
At 618 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas. Between 1 and 1.5 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible with any additional thunderstorms that form in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flows. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and downstream of the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Birney, Birney Village and southeast potions of the Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Hanging Woman Creek, East Fork O'Dell Creek, Stocker Branch, Tongue River, North Fork Lee Creek.
info.instruction:
This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Northern Remington and McGhee Burn Areas. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE NORTHERN REMINGTON AND MCGHEE BURN AREAS REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN ROSEBUD COUNTY
